entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 3:53AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOODING POSSIBLE ON THE TANANA RIVER STARTING TODAY... Glacial rivers draining the Alaska Range such as the Tanana, Chisana, and Nabesna Rivers are near bankfull. This is due to high freezing levels causing significant high elevation snow melt in the Alaska Range. This along with periods of heavy showers over the Southeast Interior through Monday have dropped significant
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued July 11 at 9:13PM SST by NWS
entry.summary: ...A High Surf Advisory remains in effect...... * SURF...Surfs of 10 to 12 feet will continue to impact south and east facing shores due to a large southerly swell and moderate to fresh tradewinds. * TIMING...through Saturday. * IMPACTS...strong rip currents and large surfs.
